pr_title: Units for reactive and apparent power

timeline.message:
[core] units var/varh/kvar/kvarh fixed

* var and varh were missing
* var is basically an alternate form of WATT
* kvarh was incorrectly marked as a division between kvar and hour

Signed-off-by: Nagy Attila Gabor <mrbig@sneaker.hu>

timeline.bodyText:

timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText:
There is a problem with this check:
assertThat(SmartHomeUnits.VAR_HOUR.getSymbol(), is("varh"));
Namely, that ProductUnit does not calculate the symbol propert when there are multiple units. I'm not sure why is it so, but there's a fixme in the sourcecode: https://github.com/unitsofmeasurement/uom-se/blob/master/src/main/java/tec/uom/se/unit/ProductUnit.java#L111

Additionally dose it make sense to add a test for the comparison to other units of the dimension power (e.g. (1 var = 1 W)?

I'm uncertain about that. Wikipedia says: "The volt-ampere is dimensionally equivalent to the watt (in SI units, 1 VA = 1 N m A-1 s -1 A = 1 N m s -1 = 1 J s -1 = 1 W)." But as I understand there's no such thing that we convert from var to watts because you will measure different things in W/VA/var. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volt-ampere
How should such a test look like in your opinion?
replies.author: mrbig

replies.bodyText: note: I've pushed a version where I've entered the getSymbol() checks, but commented them out, because they now break the tests.
replies.author: mrbig

replies.bodyText:
ProductUnit does not calculate the symbol

We can open an issue in https://github.com/unitsofmeasurement/uom-se/issues and ask them to fix it 😉.

How should such a test look like in your opinion?

I did my research on German Wikipedia. I have the feeling there is a mistake about the formular on it compared to your link. Thus it does not make sense to introduce further tests.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText:
ProductUnit does not calculate the symbol

We can open an issue in https://github.com/unitsofmeasurement/uom-se/issues and ask them to fix it .

Did some research and it looks like the do not have the intention to fix this: unitsofmeasurement/uom-se#184
The preferred way is to use the toString() unless dealing with a specific BaseUnit.
replies.author: mrbig
mrbig

replies.bodyText: Okay, I see. Thanks for the research. We should keep the toString() tests and omit the getSymbol() tests for those units.
replies.author: cweitkamp
